tuv.seg: Article 28 of Bunreacht na hÉireann (the Irish Constitution) sets out the composition of Government
Leagann alt 28 Bunreacht na hÉireann síos comhdhéanamh na Rialtais
The Constitution states that the Government must not be smaller than 7 members or larger than 15 members
Deireann Bunreacht na hÉireann go bhfuil gá le níos mó ná 7 mball agus gan níos mó ná 15 ball a bheith in aon Rialtas
The Taoiseach is the head of the Irish Government
Tá an Taoiseach i gceannas an Rialtais
He or she is nominated by the Dáil (one of the houses of Parliament) and formally appointed by the Irish President
Cuireann an Dáil a hainm nó a ainm ar aghaidh agus glacann an tUachtarán go foirimiúil leis an ainmiú
Normally, each of the political parties or a coalition of parties will have its own nominee for Taoiseach
De ghnáth cuireann gach páirtí polaitiúil, nó gach comhrialtas páirtithe, ainm chun cinn le seasamh mar Thaoiseach
The nominee who has the support of the majority of the members of the Dáil will become Taoiseach
An té a fhaigheann tacaíocht ó thromlach na mball sa Dáil a bheidh ina T(h)aoiseach
The Taoiseach then nominates the other members of the Government and gives each of them a Department of State
Ainmníonn an Taoiseach, ansin, baill eile den Rialtas agus tugann Roinn Stáit dóibh
They are approved by the Dáil and appointed by the President. You can view this list of current Irish Government Ministers
Faigheann siad seo tacaíocht na Dála agus glacann an tUachtarán leis an gceapáchán
If the Government is made up of 2 or more political parties, it is called a coalition government
Má tá níos mó ná páirtí polaitiúil amháin sa Rialtas tugtar comhrialtas ar an gcinéal seo Rialtais
The 2 parties will share the positions in the Government - usually the position of Tánaiste is given to the leader of the smaller party in coalition
Roinneann na páirtithe na postanna sa Rialtas - de ghnáth tugtar post an Tánaiste do cheannaire an pháirtí is lú sa chomhrialtas
The members of the Government must be members of either Dáil Éireann or Seanad Éireann
Ní mór do bhaill an Rialtais a bheith ina mbaill de Dáil Éireann nó ina mbaill de Sheanad Éireann
There cannot be more than 2 members of Seanad Éireann appointed to the Government
Ní féidir níos mó na beirt bhall de Sheanad Éireann a bheith ina mbaill den Rialtas
The Taoiseach, the Tánaiste and the Minister for Finance must be members of Dáil Éireann
Caithfidh an Taoiseach, an Tánaiste agus an tAire Airgeadais a bheith ina mbaill de Dháil Éireann
The Taoiseach may also appoint Ministers of State who are also known as Junior Ministers
Is féidir leis an Taoiseach Airí Stáit a roghnú freisin, ainm eile a thugtar orthu ná Airí Sóisearacha
They are not actually members of the Cabinet but they help Government ministers in their parliamentary and departmental work
Ní baill den chomh-aireacht iad ach cuidíonn siad leis na hAirí Rialtais ina gcuid oibre Rialtais agus ina gcuid oibre sa Roinn atá faoina gcúram
The Taoiseach will also appoint an Attorney General to advise the Government on legal issues
Roghnaíonn an Taoiseach Ard-Aighne, freisin, chun comhairle dlí a chuir ar fáil don Rialtas
The Attorney General is not a member of the Government but he/she traditionally attends at Cabinet meetings
Ní ball den Rialtas An tArd-Aighne ach de réir traidisiún déanann sé/sí freastal ar chruinnithe den chomh-aireacht
